sentence.idiomatic: She was in last year's "Miss World" beauty pageant.
His favorite thing is to watch beauty pageants. All the women in them are beautiful.
You are going to study, not a beauty contest. You don't need to dress up so much.
I think he is completely qualified to serve as team leader.
You can't become a pilot; your health is not up to par.
You want to be in charge of me--are you qualified?
If you put in half of the effort he does, your grades would be better than his for sure.
He already finished it, in only half of the time.
If you could even share half of your luck with me it would be great.
The relationship between the two of them is not ordinary.
The university entrance exam and working have nothing to do with each other.
What concern is it to you if I go or not?
Having smarts doesn't necessarily mean one will be good at school.
You really don't have your own mind; whatever other people tell you to do, you do.
This competition is to see who has the brightest mind. It's not to see who is the strongest.
You cannot just judge people by their outward appearance.
She is not just beautiful on the outside; she also has a nice personality.
A man's appearance is not important. What's important is whether he has any abilities.
Although he is handsome, he doesn't have any substance.
From what she says you can tell that she is a woman of substance.
This sentence has a deep connotation.
Registration for swimming lessons has begun.
Where does one sign up for the school singing competition?
He has already signed up to be a volunteer for the Beijing Olympics.
Jiajia, we have some good news for you!
What news? We don't have to take the exam?
Even better. There's a beauty pageant that's going to start soon. You totally have to be in it!
Oh, stop joking around! How would I qualify?
If you don't qualify, who qualifies?
Jiajia, you're so pretty, plus you're such a good blogger. It would be such a shame not to do it.
Yeah. If I were half as pretty as you, I'd do it right away.
OK, first tell me something about the competition.
Miss Blogger. Participants must have their own blogs.
What does beauty have to do with blogs?
The competition is not just about who's the prettiest. The important thing is who's got brains. You've got both the looks and the smarts. Miss Blogger is so you!
Yeah, yeah. Registration has already started. Hurry over there!
Do I need to wear a bikini? If it's like that, even torture won't get me to do it.
You don't need to. The contest is about brains.
The most important thing is getting everyone to know you, and to read your blog.
OK, OK. I'll give it a try.
Yay! Jiajia is going to be famous!
